# vstack_nic (Resource)



## Example Usage

```terraform
# Manage VM NIC
resource "vstack_nic" "example_nic1" {
  vm_id           = vstack_vm.example_vm.id
  network_id      = 1234
  slot            = 1
  address         = "192.168.0.2"
  ratelimit_mbits = 0
  depends_on      = [vstack_vm.example_vm]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `network_id` (Number) Network ID.
- `slot` (Number) Slot number for the NIC.
- `vm_id` (Number) ID of the VM where this NIC is attached.

### Optional

- `address` (String) IP address of the NIC. If not provided, it may be auto-assigned by vStack.
- `ratelimit_mbits` (Number) Rate limit in Mbps for the NIC.

### Read-Only

- `id` (Number) Unique identifier of the NIC (port_id).
- `ip_guard` (Number) IP guard setting for the NIC.
- `mac` (String) MAC address of the NIC.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# NIC instance can be imported by specifying the identifier with following format "vm_id/id"
# vm_id - is the ID of the virtual machine that owns the instance of NIC that you want to import.
# id - is ID of NIC that you want to import

terraform import vstack_nic.example_nic1 1234/5678
```
